parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Lists tickets by external id. External ids don't have to be unique for each ticket. As a result, the request may return multiple tickets with the same external id.

allow_attachments.description: Permission for agents to add add attachments to a comment. Defaults to true

allow_channelback.description: Is false if channelback is disabled, true otherwise. Only applicable for channels framework ticket

assignee_email.description: Write only. The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to

assignee_id.description: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

attribute_value_ids.description: Write only. An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket

brand_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the brand this ticket is associated with

collaborator_ids.description: The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket

collaborators.description: POST requests only. Users to add as cc's when creating a ticket. See [Setting Collaborators](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-collaborators)

comment.description: Write only. An object that adds a comment to the ticket. See [Ticket comments](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_comments/). To include an attachment with the comment, see [Attaching files](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#attaching-files)

created_at.description: When this record was created

custom_fields.description: Custom fields for the ticket. See [Setting custom field values](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-custom-field-values)

custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

description.description: Read-only first comment on the ticket. When [creating a ticket](#create-ticket), use `comment` to set the description. See [Description and first comment](#description-and-first-comment)

due_at.description: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

email_cc_ids.description: The ids of agents or end users currently CC'ed on the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233) in the Support Help Center

email_ccs.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent or end users email CCs to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting email CCs](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-email-ccs)

external_id.description: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

follower_ids.description: The ids of agents currently following the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233)

followers.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting followers](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-followers)

followup_ids.description: The ids of the followups created from this ticket. Ids are only visible once the ticket is closed

forum_topic_id.description: The topic in the Zendesk Web portal this ticket originated from, if any. The Web portal is deprecated

from_messaging_channel.description: If true, the ticket's [via type](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/) is a messaging channel.

group_id.description: The group this ticket is assigned to

has_incidents.description: Is true if a ticket is a problem type and has one or more incidents linked to it. Otherwise, the value is false.

id.description: Automatically assigned when the ticket is created

is_public.description: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

macro_id.description: Write only. A macro ID to be recorded in the ticket audit

macro_ids.description: POST requests only. List of macro IDs to be recorded in the ticket audit

metadata.description: Write only. Metadata for the audit. In the `audit` object, the data is specified in the `custom` property of the `metadata` object. See [Setting Metadata](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-metadata)

organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

raw_subject.description: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See [Dynamic Content Items](/api-reference/ticketing/ticket-management/dynamic_content/)

recipient.description: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket. Notification emails for the ticket are sent from this address

requester.description: Write only. See [Creating a ticket with a new requester](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#creating-a-ticket-with-a-new-requester)

requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

safe_update.description: Write only. Optional boolean. When true and an `update_stamp` date is included, protects against ticket update collisions and returns a message to let you know if one occurs. See [Protecting against ticket update collisions](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#protecting-against-ticket-update-collisions). A value of false has the same effect as true. Omit the property to force the updates to not be safe

satisfaction_rating.description: The satisfaction rating of the ticket, if it exists, or the state of satisfaction, "offered" or "unoffered". The value is null for plan types that don't support CSAT

sharing_agreement_ids.description: The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket

status.description:
The state of the ticket.

If your account has activated custom ticket statuses, this is the ticket's
status category. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses).

subject.description: The value of the subject field for this ticket

submitter_id.description: The user who submitted the ticket. The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket

tags.description: The array of tags applied to this ticket

ticket_form_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the ticket form to render for the ticket

updated_at.description: When this record last got updated

updated_stamp.description: Write only. Datetime of last update received from API. See the `safe_update` property

url.description: The API url of this ticket

via.description: For more information, see the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference)

channel.description: This tells you how the ticket or event was created. Examples: "web", "mobile", "rule", "system"

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

via_followup_source_id.description: POST requests only. The id of a closed ticket when creating a follow-up ticket. See [Creating a follow-up ticket](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#creating-a-follow-up-ticket)

via_id.description: Write only. For more information, see the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/)

tickets.subject: Help, my printer is on fire!

ticket|additional_collaborators.description: An array of numeric IDs, emails, or objects containing name and email properties. See [Setting Collaborators](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/tickets/#setting-collaborators). An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is updated

ticket|assignee_email.description: The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to

ticket|assignee_id.description: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

ticket|attribute_value_ids.description: An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket

system.client: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/61.0.3163.100 Safari/537.36

items.description: A file represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. See [Working with url properties](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/working-with-url-properties)

deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

thumbnails.description: An array of attachment objects. Note that photo thumbnails do not have thumbnails

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

audit_id.description: The id of the ticket audit record. See [Show Audit](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_audits/#show-audit)

author_id.description: The id of the comment author. See [Author id](#author-id)

created_at.description: The time the comment was created

html_body.description: The comment formatted as HTML. See [Bodies](#bodies)

id.description: Automatically assigned when the comment is created

metadata.description: System information (web client, IP address, etc.) and comment flags, if any. See [Comment flags](#comment-flags)

plain_body.description: The comment presented as plain text. See [Bodies](#bodies)

public.description: true if a public comment; false if an internal note. The initial value set on ticket creation persists for any additional comment unless you change it

type.description: `Comment` or `VoiceComment`. The JSON object for adding voice comments to tickets is different. See [Adding voice comments to tickets](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/adding-voice-comments-to-tickets)

uploads.description: List of tokens received from [uploading files](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/#upload-files) for comment attachments. The files are attached by creating or updating tickets with the tokens. See [Attaching files](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/tickets/#attaching-files) in Tickets

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

A value of false has the same effect as true. Omit the property to force the updates to not be safe

delete.description:
#### Allowed For

* Admins
* Agents with permission to delete tickets

Agent delete permissions are set in Support. See
[Deleting tickets](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/203690936)
in the Support Help Center.

#### Ticket deletion rate limit

You can delete 400 tickets every 1 minute using this endpoint.
The rate limiting mechanism behaves as described in
[Rate limits](/api-reference/introduction/rate-limits/) in the API introduction.
Zendesk recommends that you obey the Retry-After header values.
To delete many tickets, you may use [Bulk Delete Tickets](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/tickets/#bulk-delete-tickets).

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. See [Working with url properties](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/working-with-url-properties)

deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

action.description: Type of change made. Possible values are "create", "destroy", "exported", "login", and "update"

actor_id.description: id of the user or system that initiated the change

actor_name.description: Name of the user or system that initiated the change

change_description.description: The description of the change that occurred

created_at.description: The time the audit got created

id.description: The id automatically assigned upon creation

ip_address.description: The IP address of the user doing the audit

source_id.description: The id of the item being audited

source_label.description: The name of the item being audited

source_type.description:
Item type being audited. Typically describes the system where the change
was initiated. Possible values vary based on your account's Zendesk
products and activity. Common values include "apitoken", "rule", "ticket",
"user", and "zendesk/app_market/app". The "rule" value is used for
[automations](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4408832701850),
[macros](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4408844187034),
[triggers](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4408822236058),
[views](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4408888828570),
and other automated business rules

url.description: The URL to access the audit log

example.change_description: Role changed from Administrator to End User

via.description: An object explaining how the ticket was created. See the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference)

channel.description: This tells you how the ticket or event was created. Examples: "web", "mobile", "rule", "system"

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

email.description: The author email

actions.description: An object describing what the automation will do. See [Actions reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/actions-reference)

field.description: The name of a ticket field to modify

value.description: The new value of the field

active.description: Whether the automation is active

conditions.description: An object that describes the conditions under which the automation will execute. See [Conditions reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/conditions-reference)

all.description: Logical AND. Tickets must fulfill all of the conditions to be considered matching

value.description: The value of a ticket field

any.description: Logical OR. Tickets may satisfy any of the conditions to be considered matching

updated_at.description: The time of the last update of the automation

category_id.description: The ID of the category the trigger belongs to

ticket_id.description: The id of the ticket the bookmark is for.
The id of the ticket the bookmark is for.

created_at.description: The time the bookmark was created

id.description: Automatically assigned when the bookmark is created

allow_attachments.description: Permission for agents to add add attachments to a comment. Defaults to true

allow_channelback.description: Is false if channelback is disabled, true otherwise. Only applicable for channels framework ticket

assignee_email.description: Write only. The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to

assignee_id.description: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

attribute_value_ids.description: Write only. An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket

brand_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the brand this ticket is associated with

collaborator_ids.description: The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket

collaborators.description: POST requests only. Users to add as cc's when creating a ticket. See [Setting Collaborators](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-collaborators)

comment.description: Write only. An object that adds a comment to the ticket. See [Ticket comments](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_comments/). To include an attachment with the comment, see [Attaching files](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#attaching-files)

created_at.description: When this record was created

custom_fields.description: Custom fields for the ticket. See [Setting custom field values](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-custom-field-values)

custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

description.description: Read-only first comment on the ticket. When [creating a ticket](#create-ticket), use `comment` to set the description. See [Description and first comment](#description-and-first-comment)

due_at.description: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

email_cc_ids.description: The ids of agents or end users currently CC'ed on the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233) in the Support Help Center

email_ccs.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent or end users email CCs to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting email CCs](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-email-ccs)

external_id.description: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

follower_ids.description: The ids of agents currently following the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233)

followers.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting followers](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-followers)

followup_ids.description: The ids of the followups created from this ticket. Ids are only visible once the ticket is closed

forum_topic_id.description: The topic in the Zendesk Web portal this ticket originated from, if any. The Web portal is deprecated

from_messaging_channel.description: If true, the ticket's [via type](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/) is a messaging channel.

group_id.description: The group this ticket is assigned to

has_incidents.description: Is true if a ticket is a problem type and has one or more incidents linked to it. Otherwise, the value is false.

id.description: Automatically assigned when the ticket is created

is_public.description: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

macro_id.description: Write only. A macro ID to be recorded in the ticket audit

macro_ids.description: POST requests only. List of macro IDs to be recorded in the ticket audit

metadata.description: Write only. Metadata for the audit. In the `audit` object, the data is specified in the `custom` property of the `metadata` object. See [Setting Metadata](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-metadata)

organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

raw_subject.description: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See [Dynamic Content Items](/api-reference/ticketing/ticket-management/dynamic_content/)

recipient.description: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket. Notification emails for the ticket are sent from this address

requester.description: Write only. See [Creating a ticket with a new requester](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#creating-a-ticket-with-a-new-requester)

requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

safe_update.description: Write only. Optional boolean. When true and an `update_stamp` date is included, protects against ticket update collisions and returns a message to let you know if one occurs. See [Protecting against ticket update collisions](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#protecting-against-ticket-update-collisions). A value of false has the same effect as true. Omit the property to force the updates to not be safe

satisfaction_rating.description: The satisfaction rating of the ticket, if it exists, or the state of satisfaction, "offered" or "unoffered". The value is null for plan types that don't support CSAT

sharing_agreement_ids.description: The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket

status.description:
The state of the ticket.

If your account has activated custom ticket statuses, this is the ticket's
status category. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses).

subject.description: The value of the subject field for this ticket

submitter_id.description: The user who submitted the ticket. The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket

tags.description: The array of tags applied to this ticket

ticket_form_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the ticket form to render for the ticket

updated_at.description: When this record last got updated

updated_stamp.description: Write only. Datetime of last update received from API. See the `safe_update` property

url.description: The API url of this ticket

via.description: For more information, see the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference)

channel.description: This tells you how the ticket or event was created. Examples: "web", "mobile", "rule", "system"

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

via_followup_source_id.description: POST requests only. The id of a closed ticket when creating a follow-up ticket. See [Creating a follow-up ticket](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#creating-a-follow-up-ticket)

via_id.description: Write only. For more information, see the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/)

external_id.description: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

follower_ids.description: The ids of agents currently following the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233)

followers.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting followers](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-followers)

followup_ids.description: The ids of the followups created from this ticket. Ids are only visible once the ticket is closed

forum_topic_id.description: The topic in the Zendesk Web portal this ticket originated from, if any. The Web portal is deprecated

from_messaging_channel.description: If true, the ticket's [via type](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/) is a messaging channel.

group_id.description: The group this ticket is assigned to

has_incidents.description: Is true if a ticket is a problem type and has one or more incidents linked to it. Otherwise, the value is false.

id.description: Automatically assigned when the ticket is created

is_public.description: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

macro_id.description: Write only. A macro ID to be recorded in the ticket audit

macro_ids.description: POST requests only. List of macro IDs to be recorded in the ticket audit

metadata.description: Write only. Metadata for the audit. In the `audit` object, the data is specified in the `custom` property of the `metadata` object. See [Setting Metadata](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-metadata)

organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

raw_subject.description: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See [Dynamic Content Items](/api-reference/ticketing/ticket-management/dynamic_content/)

recipient.description: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket. Notification emails for the ticket are sent from this address

requester.description: Write only. See [Creating a ticket with a new requester](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#creating-a-ticket-with-a-new-requester)

requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

safe_update.description: Write only. Optional boolean. When true and an `update_stamp` date is included, protects against ticket update collisions and returns a message to let you know if one occurs. See [Protecting against ticket update collisions](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#protecting-against-ticket-update-collisions). A value of false has the same effect as true. Omit the property to force the updates to not be safe

satisfaction_rating.description: The satisfaction rating of the ticket, if it exists, or the state of satisfaction, "offered" or "unoffered". The value is null for plan types that don't support CSAT

sharing_agreement_ids.description: The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket

status.description:
The state of the ticket.

If your account has activated custom ticket statuses, this is the ticket's
status category. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses).

subject.description: The value of the subject field for this ticket

submitter_id.description: The user who submitted the ticket. The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket

tags.description: The array of tags applied to this ticket

ticket_form_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the ticket form to render for the ticket

updated_at.description: When this record last got updated

updated_stamp.description: Write only. Datetime of last update received from API. See the `safe_update` property

url.description: The API url of this ticket

via.description: For more information, see the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference)

channel.description: This tells you how the ticket or event was created. Examples: "web", "mobile", "rule", "system"

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

via_followup_source_id.description: POST requests only. The id of a closed ticket when creating a follow-up ticket. See [Creating a follow-up ticket](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#creating-a-follow-up-ticket)

via_id.description: Write only. For more information, see the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/)

url.description: The API url of this bookmark

ticket.subject: Help, my printer is on fire!

previous_page.description: the URL of the previous page

created_at.description: The time the bookmark was created

id.description: Automatically assigned when the bookmark is created

allow_attachments.description: Permission for agents to add add attachments to a comment. Defaults to true

allow_channelback.description: Is false if channelback is disabled, true otherwise. Only applicable for channels framework ticket

assignee_email.description: Write only. The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to

assignee_id.description: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

attribute_value_ids.description: Write only. An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket

brand_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the brand this ticket is associated with

collaborator_ids.description: The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket

collaborators.description: POST requests only. Users to add as cc's when creating a ticket. See [Setting Collaborators](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-collaborators)

comment.description: Write only. An object that adds a comment to the ticket. See [Ticket comments](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_comments/). To include an attachment with the comment, see [Attaching files](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#attaching-files)

created_at.description: When this record was created

custom_fields.description: Custom fields for the ticket. See [Setting custom field values](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-custom-field-values)

custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

description.description: Read-only first comment on the ticket. When [creating a ticket](#create-ticket), use `comment` to set the description. See [Description and first comment](#description-and-first-comment)

due_at.description: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

active.description: If the brand is set as active

created_at.description: The time the brand was created

default.description: Is the brand the default brand for this account

has_help_center.description: If the brand has a Help Center

help_center_state.description: The state of the Help Center

host_mapping.description: The hostmapping to this brand, if any. Only admins view this property.

id.description: The ID automatically assigned when the brand is created

is_deleted.description: If the brand object is deleted or not

logo.description: A file represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. See [Working with url properties](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/working-with-url-properties)

deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

thumbnails.description: An array of attachment objects. Note that photo thumbnails do not have thumbnails

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

signature_template.description: The signature template for a brand

ticket_form_ids.description: The ids of ticket forms that are available for use by a brand

updated_at.description: The time of the last update of the brand

url.description: The API url of this brand

ids.description: The comma-separated list of custom ticket status ids to be set as default for their status categories

external_resource_id.description: The external ID of the resource, as passed in

status.description: The status of the import for the indicated resource

all.description: Logical AND. Tickets must fulfill all of the conditions to be considered matching

field.description: The name of a ticket field

value.description: The value of a ticket field

any.description: Logical OR. Tickets may satisfy any of the conditions to be considered matching

notes.description: Any notes you want to store about the user

only_private_comments.description: true if the user can only create private comments

This parameter is inert and has no effect. It may be deprecated in the
future.

Previously, this parameter determined whether a user could access a CSV
report in a legacy Guide dashboard. This dashboard has been removed. See

Explore](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4762263171610-Announcing-Guide-legacy-reporting-upgrade-to-Explore-)

restricted_agent.description: If the agent has any restrictions; false for admins and unrestricted agents, true for other agents

role.description: The user's role. Possible values are "end-user", "agent", or "admin"

role_type.description: The user's role id. 0 for a custom agent, 1 for a light agent, 2 for a chat agent, 3 for a chat agent added to the Support account as a contributor ([Chat Phase 4](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360022365373#topic_djh_1zk_4fb)), 4 for an admin, and 5 for a billing admin

shared.description: If the user is shared from a different Zendesk Support instance. Ticket sharing accounts only

shared_agent.description: If the user is a shared agent from a different Zendesk Support instance. Ticket sharing accounts only

shared_phone_number.description: Whether the `phone` number is shared or not. See [Phone Number](#phone-number) below

signature.description: The user's signature. Only agents and admins can have signatures

suspended.description: If the agent is suspended. Tickets from suspended users are also suspended, and these users cannot sign in to the end user portal

tags.description: The user's tags. Only present if your account has user tagging enabled

ticket_restriction.description: Specifies which tickets the user has access to. Possible values are: "organization", "groups", "assigned", "requested", null. "groups" and "assigned" are valid only for agents. If you pass an invalid value to an end user (for example, "groups"), they will be assigned to "requested", regardless of their previous access

time_zone.description: The user's time zone. See [Time Zone](#time-zone)

two_factor_auth_enabled.description: If two factor authentication is enabled

updated_at.description: The time the user was last updated

url.description: The user's API url

verified.description: Any of the user's identities is verified. See [User Identities](/api-reference/ticketing/users/user_identities)

email.description: The primary email address of this user. If the primary email address is not [verified](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4408886752410), the secondary email address is used

If updating, see [Organization ID](/api-reference/ticketing/users/users/#organization-id)

phone.description: The primary phone number of this user. See [Phone Number](/api-reference/ticketing/users/users/#phone-number) in the Users API

photo.description: The user's profile picture represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

role.description: The role of the user. Possible values: `"end-user"`, `"agent"`, `"admin"`

shared_phone_number.description: Whether the `phone` number is shared or not. See [Phone Number](/api-reference/ticketing/users/users/#phone-number) in the Users API

time_zone.description: The time-zone of this user

updated_at.description: The time of the last update of the user

url.description: The API url of this user

verified.description: Any of the user's identities is verified. See [User Identities](/api-reference/ticketing/users/user_identities)

authenticity_token.description: CSRF token required by some Zendesk APIs.

allow_attachments.description: Permission for agents to add add attachments to a comment. Defaults to true

allow_channelback.description: Is false if channelback is disabled, true otherwise. Only applicable for channels framework ticket

assignee_email.description: Write only. The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to

assignee_id.description: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

attribute_value_ids.description: Write only. An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket

brand_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the brand this ticket is associated with

collaborator_ids.description: The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket

collaborators.description: POST requests only. Users to add as cc's when creating a ticket. See [Setting Collaborators](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-collaborators)

comment.description: Write only. An object that adds a comment to the ticket. See [Ticket comments](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_comments/). To include an attachment with the comment, see [Attaching files](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#attaching-files)

created_at.description: When this record was created

custom_fields.description: Custom fields for the ticket. See [Setting custom field values](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-custom-field-values)

custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

description.description: Read-only first comment on the ticket. When [creating a ticket](#create-ticket), use `comment` to set the description. See [Description and first comment](#description-and-first-comment)

due_at.description: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

email_cc_ids.description: The ids of agents or end users currently CC'ed on the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233) in the Support Help Center

email_ccs.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent or end users email CCs to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting email CCs](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-email-ccs)

external_id.description: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

follower_ids.description: The ids of agents currently following the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233)

followers.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting followers](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-followers)

followup_ids.description: The ids of the followups created from this ticket. Ids are only visible once the ticket is closed

forum_topic_id.description: The topic in the Zendesk Web portal this ticket originated from, if any. The Web portal is deprecated

from_messaging_channel.description: If true, the ticket's [via type](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/) is a messaging channel.

group_id.description: The group this ticket is assigned to

has_incidents.description: Is true if a ticket is a problem type and has one or more incidents linked to it. Otherwise, the value is false.

id.description: Automatically assigned when the ticket is created

is_public.description: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

macro_id.description: Write only. A macro ID to be recorded in the ticket audit

macro_ids.description: POST requests only. List of macro IDs to be recorded in the ticket audit

metadata.description: Write only. Metadata for the audit. In the `audit` object, the data is specified in the `custom` property of the `metadata` object. See [Setting Metadata](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-metadata)

organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

raw_subject.description: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See [Dynamic Content Items](/api-reference/ticketing/ticket-management/dynamic_content/)

recipient.description: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket. Notification emails for the ticket are sent from this address

requester.description: Write only. See [Creating a ticket with a new requester](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#creating-a-ticket-with-a-new-requester)

requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

safe_update.description: Write only. Optional boolean. When true and an `update_stamp` date is included, protects against ticket update collisions and returns a message to let you know if one occurs. See [Protecting against ticket update collisions](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#protecting-against-ticket-update-collisions). A value of false has the same effect as true. Omit the property to force the updates to not be safe

satisfaction_rating.description: The satisfaction rating of the ticket, if it exists, or the state of satisfaction, "offered" or "unoffered". The value is null for plan types that don't support CSAT

sharing_agreement_ids.description: The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket

status.description:
The state of the ticket.

If your account has activated custom ticket statuses, this is the ticket's
status category. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses).

subject.description: The value of the subject field for this ticket

submitter_id.description: The user who submitted the ticket. The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket

tags.description: The array of tags applied to this ticket

ticket_form_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the ticket form to render for the ticket

updated_at.description: When this record last got updated

updated_stamp.description: Write only. Datetime of last update received from API. See the `safe_update` property

url.description: The API url of this ticket

via.description: For more information, see the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference)

channel.description: This tells you how the ticket or event was created. Examples: "web", "mobile", "rule", "system"

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

via_followup_source_id.description: POST requests only. The id of a closed ticket when creating a follow-up ticket. See [Creating a follow-up ticket](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#creating-a-follow-up-ticket)

via_id.description: Write only. For more information, see the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/)

tickets.subject: Help, my printer is on fire!

items.description: A file represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. See [Working with url properties](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/working-with-url-properties)

deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

thumbnails.description: An array of attachment objects. Note that photo thumbnails do not have thumbnails

created_at.description: When the resource collection was created

id.description: id for the resource collection. Automatically assigned upon creation

resources.description: Array of resource metadata objects. See [Resource objects](#resource-objects)

updated_at.description: Last time the resource collection was updated

created_at.description: When the resource collection was created

id.description: id for the resource collection. Automatically assigned upon creation

resources.description: Array of resource metadata objects. See [Resource objects](#resource-objects)

updated_at.description: Last time the resource collection was updated

created_at.description: When the resource collection was created

id.description: id for the resource collection. Automatically assigned upon creation

resources.description: Array of resource metadata objects. See [Resource objects](#resource-objects)

updated_at.description: Last time the resource collection was updated

active.description: false if the user has been deleted

alias.description: An alias displayed to end users

chat_only.description: Whether or not the user is a chat-only agent

created_at.description: The time the user was created

custom_role_id.description: A custom role if the user is an agent on the Enterprise plan or above

default_group_id.description: The id of the user's default group

details.description: Any details you want to store about the user, such as an address

email.description: The user's primary email address. *Writeable on create only. On update, a secondary email is added. See [Email Address](#email-address)

external_id.description: A unique identifier from another system. The API treats the id as case insensitive. Example: "ian1" and "IAN1" are the same value.

iana_time_zone.description: The time zone for the user

id.description: Automatically assigned when the user is created

last_login_at.description:
Last time the user signed in to Zendesk Support or made an API request
using an API token or basic authentication

locale.description: The user's locale. A BCP-47 compliant tag for the locale. If both "locale" and "locale_id" are present on create or update, "locale_id" is ignored and only "locale" is used.

moderator.description: Designates whether the user has forum moderation capabilities

notes.description: Any notes you want to store about the user

only_private_comments.description: true if the user can only create private comments

organization_id.description: The id of the user's organization. If the user has more than one [organization memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/), the id of the user's default organization. If updating, see [Organization ID](#organization-id)

phone.description: The user's primary phone number. See [Phone Number](#phone-number) below

photo.description: The user's profile picture represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

remote_photo_url.description: A URL pointing to the user's profile picture.

report_csv.description:
This parameter is inert and has no effect. It may be deprecated in the
future.

Previously, this parameter determined whether a user could access a CSV
report in a legacy Guide dashboard. This dashboard has been removed. See
[Announcing Guide legacy reporting upgrade to
Explore](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4762263171610-Announcing-Guide-legacy-reporting-upgrade-to-Explore-)

restricted_agent.description: If the agent has any restrictions; false for admins and unrestricted agents, true for other agents

role.description: The user's role. Possible values are "end-user", "agent", or "admin"

role_type.description: The user's role id. 0 for a custom agent, 1 for a light agent, 2 for a chat agent, 3 for a chat agent added to the Support account as a contributor ([Chat Phase 4](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360022365373#topic_djh_1zk_4fb)), 4 for an admin, and 5 for a billing admin

shared.description: If the user is shared from a different Zendesk Support instance. Ticket sharing accounts only

shared_agent.description: If the user is a shared agent from a different Zendesk Support instance. Ticket sharing accounts only

shared_phone_number.description: Whether the `phone` number is shared or not. See [Phone Number](#phone-number) below

signature.description: The user's signature. Only agents and admins can have signatures

suspended.description: If the agent is suspended. Tickets from suspended users are also suspended, and these users cannot sign in to the end user portal

tags.description: The user's tags. Only present if your account has user tagging enabled

ticket_restriction.description: Specifies which tickets the user has access to. Possible values are: "organization", "groups", "assigned", "requested", null. "groups" and "assigned" are valid only for agents. If you pass an invalid value to an end user (for example, "groups"), they will be assigned to "requested", regardless of their previous access

time_zone.description: The user's time zone. See [Time Zone](#time-zone)

two_factor_auth_enabled.description: If two factor authentication is enabled

updated_at.description: The time the user was last updated

url.description: The user's API url

user_fields.description: Values of custom fields in the user's profile. See [User Fields](#user-fields)

verified.description: Any of the user's identities is verified. See [User Identities](/api-reference/ticketing/users/user_identities)

created_at.description: The time the user was created

email.description: The primary email address of this user. If the primary email address is not [verified](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4408886752410), the secondary email address is used

iana_time_zone.description: The time zone for the user

locale_id.description: The language identifier for this user

organization_id.description: The id of the user's organization. If the user has more than one [organization memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/), the id of the user's default organization. If updating, see [Organization ID](/api-reference/ticketing/users/users/#organization-id)

phone.description: The primary phone number of this user. See [Phone Number](/api-reference/ticketing/users/users/#phone-number) in the Users API

photo.description: The user's profile picture represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

role.description: The role of the user. Possible values: `"end-user"`, `"agent"`, `"admin"`

shared_phone_number.description: Whether the `phone` number is shared or not. See [Phone Number](/api-reference/ticketing/users/users/#phone-number) in the Users API

time_zone.description: The time-zone of this user

updated_at.description: The time of the last update of the user

url.description: The API url of this user

verified.description: Any of the user's identities is verified. See [User Identities](/api-reference/ticketing/users/user_identities)

Responses don't include this property

attachments.description: The attachments, if any associated to this suspended ticket. See [Attachments](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/)

items.description: A file represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. See [Working with url properties](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/working-with-url-properties)

deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

thumbnails.description: An array of attachment objects. Note that photo thumbnails do not have thumbnails

Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

items.description: A file represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

safe_update.description: Optional boolean. Prevents updates with outdated ticket data (`updated_stamp` property required when true)

sharing_agreement_ids.description: An array of the numeric IDs of sharing agreements. Note that this replaces any existing agreements

tags.description: The array of tags applied to this ticket

Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

audit_id.description: The id of the ticket audit record. See [Show Audit](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_audits/#show-audit)

author_id.description: The id of the comment author. See [Author id](#author-id)

created_at.description: The time the comment was created

html_body.description: The comment formatted as HTML. See [Bodies](#bodies)

id.description: Automatically assigned when the comment is created

metadata.description: System information (web client, IP address, etc.) and comment flags, if any. See [Comment flags](#comment-flags)

plain_body.description: The comment presented as plain text. See [Bodies](#bodies)

public.description: true if a public comment; false if an internal note. The initial value set on ticket creation persists for any additional comment unless you change it

type.description: `Comment` or `VoiceComment`. The JSON object for adding voice comments to tickets is different. See [Adding voice comments to tickets](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/adding-voice-comments-to-tickets)

uploads.description: List of tokens received from [uploading files](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/#upload-files) for comment attachments. The files are attached by creating or updating tickets with the tokens. See [Attaching files](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/tickets/#attaching-files) in Tickets

channel.description: This tells you how the ticket or event was created. Examples: "web", "mobile", "rule", "system"

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

allow_channelback.description: Is false if channelback is disabled, true otherwise. Only applicable for channels framework ticket

assignee_email.description: Write only. The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to

assignee_id.description: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

attribute_value_ids.description: Write only. An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket

brand_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the brand this ticket is associated with

collaborator_ids.description: The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket

collaborators.description: POST requests only. Users to add as cc's when creating a ticket. See [Setting Collaborators](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-collaborators)

comment.description: Write only. An object that adds a comment to the ticket. See [Ticket comments](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_comments/). To include an attachment with the comment, see [Attaching files](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#attaching-files)

created_at.description: When this record was created

custom_fields.description: Custom fields for the ticket. See [Setting custom field values](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-custom-field-values)

custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

description.description: Read-only first comment on the ticket. When [creating a ticket](#create-ticket), use `comment` to set the description. See [Description and first comment](#description-and-first-comment)

due_at.description: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

email_cc_ids.description: The ids of agents or end users currently CC'ed on the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233) in the Support Help Center

email_ccs.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent or end users email CCs to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting email CCs](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-email-ccs)

external_id.description: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

follower_ids.description: The ids of agents currently following the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233)

followers.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting followers](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-followers)

followup_ids.description: The ids of the followups created from this ticket. Ids are only visible once the ticket is closed

forum_topic_id.description: The topic in the Zendesk Web portal this ticket originated from, if any. The Web portal is deprecated

from_messaging_channel.description: If true, the ticket's [via type](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/) is a messaging channel.

group_id.description: The group this ticket is assigned to

has_incidents.description: Is true if a ticket is a problem type and has one or more incidents linked to it. Otherwise, the value is false.

id.description: Automatically assigned when the ticket is created

is_public.description: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

macro_id.description: Write only. A macro ID to be recorded in the ticket audit

macro_ids.description: POST requests only. List of macro IDs to be recorded in the ticket audit

metadata.description: Write only. Metadata for the audit. In the `audit` object, the data is specified in the `custom` property of the `metadata` object. See [Setting Metadata](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-metadata)

organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

raw_subject.description: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See [Dynamic Content Items](/api-reference/ticketing/ticket-management/dynamic_content/)

recipient.description: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket. Notification emails for the ticket are sent from this address

requester.description: Write only. See [Creating a ticket with a new requester](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#creating-a-ticket-with-a-new-requester)

requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

safe_update.description: Write only. Optional boolean. When true and an `update_stamp` date is included, protects against ticket update collisions and returns a message to let you know if one occurs. See [Protecting against ticket update collisions](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#protecting-against-ticket-update-collisions). A value of false has the same effect as true. Omit the property to force the updates to not be safe

satisfaction_rating.description: The satisfaction rating of the ticket, if it exists, or the state of satisfaction, "offered" or "unoffered". The value is null for plan types that don't support CSAT

sharing_agreement_ids.description: The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket

status category. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses).

items.description: A file represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. See [Working with url properties](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/working-with-url-properties)

deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

thumbnails.description: An array of attachment objects. Note that photo thumbnails do not have thumbnails

custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

due_at.description: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

email_ccs.description: An array of objects that represent agent or end users email CCs to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting email CCs](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-email-ccs)

external_id.description: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

followers.description: An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting followers](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-followers)

group_id.description: The group this ticket is assigned to

organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

safe_update.description: Optional boolean. Prevents updates with outdated ticket data (`updated_stamp` property required when true)

sharing_agreement_ids.description: An array of the numeric IDs of sharing agreements. Note that this replaces any existing agreements

status.description:
The state of the ticket.

If your account has activated custom ticket statuses, this is the ticket's
status category. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses).

subject.description: The value of the subject field for this ticket

tags.description: The array of tags applied to this ticket

updated_stamp.description: Datetime of last update received from API. See the safe_update property

example.subject: My printer is on fire!

via.description: An object explaining how the ticket was created. See the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference)

channel.description: This tells you how the ticket or event was created. Examples: "web", "mobile", "rule", "system"

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

allow_attachments.description: Permission for agents to add add attachments to a comment. Defaults to true

allow_channelback.description: Is false if channelback is disabled, true otherwise. Only applicable for channels framework ticket

assignee_email.description: Write only. The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to

assignee_id.description: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

attribute_value_ids.description: Write only. An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket

brand_id.description: Enterprise only. The id of the brand this ticket is associated with

collaborator_ids.description: The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket

collaborators.description: POST requests only. Users to add as cc's when creating a ticket. See [Setting Collaborators](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-collaborators)

comment.description: Write only. An object that adds a comment to the ticket. See [Ticket comments](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_comments/). To include an attachment with the comment, see [Attaching files](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#attaching-files)

created_at.description: When this record was created

custom_fields.description: Custom fields for the ticket. See [Setting custom field values](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-custom-field-values)

custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

description.description: Read-only first comment on the ticket. When [creating a ticket](#create-ticket), use `comment` to set the description. See [Description and first comment](#description-and-first-comment)

due_at.description: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

email_cc_ids.description: The ids of agents or end users currently CC'ed on the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233) in the Support Help Center

email_ccs.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent or end users email CCs to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting email CCs](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-email-ccs)

external_id.description: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

follower_ids.description: The ids of agents currently following the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233)

followers.description: Write only. An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting followers](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-followers)

followup_ids.description: The ids of the followups created from this ticket. Ids are only visible once the ticket is closed

forum_topic_id.description: The topic in the Zendesk Web portal this ticket originated from, if any. The Web portal is deprecated

from_messaging_channel.description: If true, the ticket's [via type](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference/) is a messaging channel.

group_id.description: The group this ticket is assigned to

has_incidents.description: Is true if a ticket is a problem type and has one or more incidents linked to it. Otherwise, the value is false.

id.description: Automatically assigned when the ticket is created

is_public.description: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

macro_id.description: Write only. A macro ID to be recorded in the ticket audit

macro_ids.description: POST requests only. List of macro IDs to be recorded in the ticket audit

metadata.description: Write only. Metadata for the audit. In the `audit` object, the data is specified in the `custom` property of the `metadata` object. See [Setting Metadata](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#setting-metadata)

organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

raw_subject.description: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See [Dynamic Content Items](/api-reference/ticketing/ticket-management/dynamic_content/)

recipient.description: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket. Notification emails for the ticket are sent from this address

requester.description: Write only. See [Creating a ticket with a new requester](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#creating-a-ticket-with-a-new-requester)

requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

safe_update.description: Write only. Optional boolean. When true and an `update_stamp` date is included, protects against ticket update collisions and returns a message to let you know if one occurs. See [Protecting against ticket update collisions](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets/#protecting-against-ticket-update-collisions). A value of false has the same effect as true. Omit the property to force the updates to not be safe

satisfaction_rating.description: The satisfaction rating of the ticket, if it exists, or the state of satisfaction, "offered" or "unoffered". The value is null for plan types that don't support CSAT

sharing_agreement_ids.description: The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket

status.description:
The state of the ticket.

If your account has activated custom ticket statuses, this is the ticket's
status category. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses).
